word_type: verb, verb; verb, adjective, transitive, intransitive: To cause to diverge.; verb, verb; verb, verb, transitive, intransitive: To go off course from; change course; plan.
definitions: To deviate is a 'verb'; and can mean 'to fall outside of or part from some norm' as well as being synonymous with causing divergence. It also signifies physically going off track, changing plans, or straying.
examples: His exhibition of nude paintings deviated from the norm; She began to feel a slight deviation in her studies after starting yoga classes
